title: Love Island's Maura Higgins says bosses 'encouraged her to dump boyfriend to star on show last year'
text:
Maura Higgins has claimed Love Island bosses tried to get her to join the show last year- despite having a boyfriend.

The Irish grid girl, 28, said she was in a six-month relationship when she was approached by producers, who urged her to dump her boyfriend so she could enter the villa.

Maura said her boyfriend at the time was furious, when bosses said of her short-term relationship: 'you don’t really know that that’s going to last.'

In a relationship: Maura Higgins has claimed Love Island bosses tried to get her to join the show last year- despite having a boyfriend

Maura went on to star on the hit ITV2 show earlier this year and sparked up a romance with Curtis Pritchard.

Speaking at Girls With Goals on Her.ie, Maura said: 'I remember last year when they called me up and I was with my ex – we had been together about six months and I said "no I’m in a relationship".

'They were like "how long have you been with that guy" and I said "six months" and they were like "well you don’t really know that that’s going to last" and they said to me ‘if anything happens closer to the show, let us know and we’ll get you in there’.

'My boyfriend wasn’t very happy.'

Loved-up: Maura went on to star on the hit ITV2 show earlier this year and sparked up a romance with Curtis Pritchard (pictured earlier this week at Specsavers Award ceremony)

Reality star in the making: Maura said: 'I remember last year when they called me up and I was with my ex – we had been together about six months and I said "no I’m in a relationship"

MailOnline has contacted Love Island for comment.

Prior to her short relationship with her ex-boyfriend, Maura was engaged to her childhood sweetheart James Finnegan, a car mechanic.

Maura split from him two years ago. Maura’s mother Sharon said her daughter was ‘deeply in love’ with mechanic James, but their relationship had simply 'fizzled out'.

Meanwhile, the reality star's romance with Curtis, 23, is going from strength-to-strength.

Romance: Maura continued: 'They were like "how long have you been with that guy" and I said "six months" and they were like "well you don’t really know that that’s going to last"

The couple, who are yet to make their relationship official, put on a united display at the Specavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year.

Maura and Curtis' PDA-filled appearance comes just days after she admitted in an interview with The Irish Mirror at the start on the month they hadn't seen each other in two weeks.

During the interview Maura was quizzed on whether Curtis had finally asked her to be his girlfriend.

Absence makes the heart grow fonder: The reality star's romance with Curtis, 23, is going from strength-to-strength. Here they are pictured arm-in-arm on Tuesday

'He's not,' she said, adding: 'So we haven't seen each other in two weeks but that's because of our hectic schedules, but I mean, I'm happy with the pace we're going and I think he is as well.'

On how they manage with such hectic schedules, Maura said: 'I mean, it's not hard. I don't find it hard because I'm kept busy and he is too.

'Obviously it's very different after coming out of the villa where you were with each other 24/7, but coming out, it's a whole new relationship.

Meanwhile, in a separate interview with The Sun, Curtis insisted that their unlabelled relationship is going strong and will not be shaken when Maura competes on Dancing On Ice next year.
description: Maura Higgins has claimed Love Island bosses tried to get her to join the show last year- despite having a boyfriend.
